fill_blank.q: She ___ to school every day.
fill_blank.explain: Third person singular present tense: she goes.

fill_blank.q: I ___ a student.
fill_blank.explain: First person singular: I am.

fill_blank.q: They ___ playing football.
fill_blank.explain: Plural subject takes 'are'.

fill_blank.q: He ___ breakfast at 7 AM.
fill_blank.explain: Third person singular: he has.

fill_blank.q: We ___ from Egypt.
fill_blank.explain: Plural subject: we are.

fill_blank.q: She ___ not like coffee.
fill_blank.explain: Third person negative: does not.

fill_blank.q: ___ you speak English?
fill_blank.explain: Question form with 'you': Do you...?

fill_blank.q: The cat is ___ the table.
fill_blank.explain: On the surface: on the table.

fill_blank.q: I ___ to the store yesterday.
fill_blank.explain: Past tense of 'go' is 'went'.

fill_blank.q: There ___ many people at the party.
fill_blank.explain: Plural past: there were.

fill_blank.q: If I ___ rich, I would travel the world.
fill_blank.explain: Subjunctive mood: If I were (hypothetical).

fill_blank.q: She has been studying ___ three hours.
fill_blank.explain: 'For' is used with durations of time.

fill_blank.q: I wish I ___ speak French fluently.
fill_blank.explain: Wish + past tense: I wish I could.

fill_blank.q: He asked me ___ I was going.
fill_blank.explain: Indirect question: asked where I was going.

fill_blank.q: The book ___ on the shelf for years.
fill_blank.explain: Present perfect: has been (singular subject).

fill_blank.q: Neither the teacher nor the students ___ ready.
fill_blank.explain: Neither...nor with plural closest noun: were.

fill_blank.q: By the time we arrived, the movie ___.
fill_blank.explain: Past perfect for action completed before another past action.

fill_blank.q: She is used ___ early in the morning.
fill_blank.explain: "Used to + gerund" means accustomed to.

fill_blank.q: I'd rather you ___ me the truth.
fill_blank.explain: I'd rather + past tense for preferences about others.

fill_blank.q: Not until he left ___ I realize my mistake.
fill_blank.explain: Inverted structure: Not until... did I...

fill_blank.q: ___ the weather been better, we would have gone hiking.
fill_blank.explain: Third conditional inversion: Had + past participle.

fill_blank.q: The CEO, along with the board members, ___ decided to restructure.
fill_blank.explain: Subject is 'CEO' (singular); 'along with' doesn't change it.

fill_blank.q: Seldom ___ such an impressive performance.
fill_blank.explain: Inversion after negative adverb: Seldom have I seen.

fill_blank.q: It's high time you ___ a decision.
fill_blank.explain: It's high time + past tense (subjunctive).

fill_blank.q: She spoke ___ eloquently that everyone was moved.
fill_blank.explain: So + adverb + that clause.

fill_blank.q: The report needs ___ before the deadline.
fill_blank.explain: Passive infinitive: needs to be finished.

fill_blank.q: ___ no circumstances should you open this door.
fill_blank.explain: Fixed expression: Under no circumstances + inversion.

fill_blank.q: He denied ___ involved in the scandal.
fill_blank.explain: Deny + gerund: denied being.

fill_blank.q: The more you practice, the ___ you become.
fill_blank.explain: Comparative in parallel structure: the more... the better.

fill_blank.q: Were it not ___ his help, we would have failed.
fill_blank.explain: Were it not for = If it weren't for.

sentence_reorder.answer: I like to eat pizza
She is a good teacher
We go to school every day
The cat is sleeping on the bed
My brother plays football after school
Can you help me please
There are many books on the shelf
I don't like cold weather
He always drinks coffee in the morning
What time does the movie start
She has been studying for three hours
If I were you I would apologize
By the time we arrived they had already left
Not only is she smart but also kind
Despite the heavy rain we went out
He told me that he was not coming
I will have finished the project by Friday
The more you practice the better you get
I like neither coffee nor tea
I was wondering what you think
Had I known earlier I would have acted differently
Under no circumstances should this confidential information be shared
Despite it having been raining all day they persevered
Seldom have I seen such a remarkable display of talent
Were it not for her determination she would never have succeeded

alternatives: I like reading
I enjoy reading
The weather is nice today
Where's the hospital?

translation.answer: I want a glass of water please
alternatives: I'd like a glass of water please
Can I have a glass of water please

translation.answer: He works at a big company
alternatives: He works in a large company

translation.source: لو كنت مكانك كنت هتكلم معاه
translation.answer: If I were you I would talk to him
alternatives: If I were in your place I would speak with him

translation.answer: Despite the rain, we went out
alternatives: Although it was raining, we went out
In spite of the rain, we went out

translation.source: لازم تكون خلصت المشروع قبل الجمعة
translation.answer: You must have finished the project before Friday
alternatives: You should finish the project before Friday

translation.source: كل ما تتمرن أكتر، كل ما تبقى أحسن
translation.answer: The more you practice, the better you get
alternatives: The more you practice, the better you become
Who said that to you?

translation.answer: Had it not been for his help, we would not have succeeded
alternatives: Were it not for his help, we would have failed
Without his help, we wouldn't have succeeded

translation.source: نادراً ما شفت حاجة مبهرة كده
translation.answer: Seldom have I seen something so impressive
alternatives: Rarely have I witnessed something this remarkable

translation.answer: He should have finished the work by now
alternatives: He ought to have completed the work by now

translation.answer: No matter what happens, I won't change my mind
alternatives: Whatever happens, I will not change my mind
Regardless of what happens, my mind won't change

translation.source: اللي بيزاكر بجد بيجيب نتيجة كويسة
translation.answer: Those who study hard get good results
alternatives: Whoever studies seriously achieves good results
